intro: Brassavola venosa, commonly known as the Venosa orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern. Brassavola venosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is relatively easy to cultivate under the right conditions.
